text:
So I reported this issue a while back and it appears someone at HS recently patched it: if you have a field in a custom module, with the variable name css_class it will conflict with the template level css_class, where updating the value at the template level updates the value of the custom module and vice versa.

I just discovered this: <https://spin.d.pr/r0My3t+>
please tell me this is just a hotfix/bandaid 

Personally I’d think all of the HS design manager fields should all be atleast prefixed with hs_ or something.

Maybe I’m in the minority though, and should just deal with it and add my own prefix around it.
If only we had a time machine to go back and fix all those modules that already used these names… :slightly_smiling_face:
or are you more a Delorean guy?

I've always found with any naming convention to use more descriptive naming conventions. for css class I would have chosen module_css_class or two_column_css_class that way it is more descriptive and helps to avoid specific conflicts like this
